task.title: Configure Memcached
task.shortdesc: Configuring memcached is required for the eucaconsole service to use memcached on a single host. The configuration provided instructs the memcached service to only accept connections from localhost. If you wish to run multiple eucaconsoles on separate hosts, you should set up a common memcached instance that accepts connections from those hosts.

prereq.note: This procedure assumes that the Eucalyptus Management Console package is installed. For instructions on installing the packages, see the Installing the Eucalyptus Management Console section.

If there is just one Console server, we recommend co-locating memcached on that server for optimum speed. Since memcached isn't critical to the functioning of the Console, a single memcached instance would suffice. If memcached were to go down, replacing it with another instance is adequate.

task.shortdesc: Changing the ufshost (formerly clchost) could cause the image cache to not properly refresh in the Launch Instance and Create Launch Configuration wizards, which prevents the launching of instancese and creating launch configurations. Clearing (flushing) memcached in the Console will refresh the cache to properly resume operations.
